website_summaries.verdict: Easy to apply, while giving you the longevity and toughness you need in an engine enamel paint.
pros: You'll have nearly two dozen different choices of colors with this brand, all of which are manufactured to meet original engine standards
Able to withstand temperatures up to 500 degrees Fahrenheit
Resistant to common engine fluids like oil and gasoline
cons: Spray nozzle pattern may be too wide for some people's liking, as it is tough to control

customer_reviews.title: Worked Great
customer_reviews.text: I've rebuilt many mopar engines over the years and tried many different paints (Duplicolor, Mopar, Rust-o-Leum, spray-booth paint) and this was the best covering, best shining, and most durable paint I've run across....other than using a quart of paint & a spray nozzle. So for a rattle-can paint, I definitely would go with this again!
customer_reviews.author: Dani v

customer_reviews.title: Color dosent match/Not high temp resistant
customer_reviews.text: Everything worked great except for the color. Dosent match well at all. Bought 3 cans of Pontiac blue and it's mostly silver with a hint of sea green. Update: Complete waste of money. My smoker has NOT gone beyond 300 degrees and this 500 degree paint has burned off. Stay away from this junk. Would love a refund for this
customer_reviews.author: Charles Haskett

customer_reviews.title: Not the color of the cap....not even close!
customer_reviews.text: The color of the cap is much more orange than the actual paint color. The actual color is "sun" yellow. How can they be this far off? No QC is my guess. I would send it back, but why bother? Could not use it.
customer_reviews.author: MnBoy

customer_reviews.title: Exact color match IF you shake the can long enough
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 cans, glad it was available on Amazon because I couldn't find it anywhere else and it's good quality paint and an exact color match--IF you shake the cans enough. I'm familiar with the rattle can, we go way back. These needed to be shaken for a looonnnnggggg time. When you don't do it, you get dark blue that eventually goes to the correct light blue. Other than that, this was a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm currently using the second can and it is working fine so far
customer_reviews.text: I ordered multiple cans. I used one partially, cleared it, and went to use it a week later and nothing came out. It was still approximately 80% full, but it was either clogged or out of aerosol as no paint would come out. I'm currently using the second can and it is working fine so far. Good coverage and it doesn't take much to coat the item (I was painting an engine block and heads). The low star rating is primarily for, what I think, is a defective can.
customer_reviews.author: Onion

customer_reviews.title: Very good match on 1975 FE 360
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 75 f100 with a 360 in it. Very close match. Casual observer wouldn't notice. That said, I'm told Ford didn't pay close attention to the quality of their engine paint, so the stock shade of blue was very inconsistent. Mine was built in San Jose in June of 75. If yours was built at a different place or time you may have a different experience
customer_reviews.author: Rob M.

customer_reviews.title: great engine gloss.
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my engine cover. Holds heat and coats nice and even.
customer_reviews.author: Tommyz

customer_reviews.title: The paint does spray well and cover good.
customer_reviews.text: This is more of an orange than what I wanted. it is red but not the red I was expecting. I painted over it. The paint does spray well and cover good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good match
customer_reviews.text: I have tried many other paints to duplicate the hemi orange on mopar performance 340 engine. This is the closest I have found and resists runs. Very good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent color and coverage
customer_reviews.text: This was bought to paint a 1972 Ford Ranchero 6.6l 400m motor and parts during a rebuild. This paint covered the metal very well, didn't have any run issues when sprayed, and the dried color is excellent. The color matches the original blue OEM valve covers perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: MTB

customer_reviews.title: Low quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought two cans of this to paint my engine and I haven't even finished installing it yet and the paint is starting to flake off. And to add on to that the two cans were supposed to be the same color but they are visibly different color blues
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Bode

customer_reviews.title: A-OKAY!
customer_reviews.text: I am quite pleased with this item! I would gladly recommend this seller & product to others.
customer_reviews.author: Parlous1

customer_reviews.title: A very versatile product for under hood enhancment
customer_reviews.text: Aside from adding durability and a nice shine to their colored engine paint, I found this to be really great for sealing in the shine of other engine compartment bits and pieces. Unlike clear ureathane, which yellows when exposed to sustained high temperature, this stuff stays clear. So if you have, for example, an aluminum intake manifold that you's like to keep looking new, this clear coat works like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Cornfield Folkie

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great price and exactly the sheen I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Spinn

customer_reviews.title: Used on my ohc 6.  Looks great!
customer_reviews.text: Was trying to find a color that was close to the original. This was close enough and looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not heat resistant
customer_reviews.text: I used this along with the primer on my sportster engine and exhaust and as soon as I started the bike up it started smoking. I thought there was an exhaust leak but noticed the paint started to peel and burn off soon after.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to paint the knobs on my SS stove. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This product is the best!
customer_reviews.text: You'll never buy the brands sold at home improvement stores ever again. This product is the best!
customer_reviews.author: kalman

customer_reviews.title: so far so good. Used it on some valve covers for a ...
customer_reviews.text: so far so good. Used it on some valve covers for a 86 vette. it is shiny...thought it might have more of a matte look, but over all I like it over what they looked like.
customer_reviews.author: Bowtie29

customer_reviews.title: ... my ugly drum smoker with this and it looks great.
customer_reviews.text: painted my ugly drum smoker with this and it looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Rikard

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this sh*t is amazing! Seriously! This stuff has a extremely nice finish. I’m impressed so much I’m considering buying more to do other projects.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Plastikote Paint
customer_reviews.text: The paint arrived quickly and as described. The color was exactly what I wanted and the price was much cheaper than the local stores. I would purchase again, if I need to.
customer_reviews.author: cgarcia

customer_reviews.title: Too bad the price keeps rising on Amazon for this since ...
customer_reviews.text: Very durable paint that has the correct shade of Ford Blue. Too bad the price keeps rising on Amazon for this since I last ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't spray with as much pressure as some, but didn't clog, and left a thick, glossy finish.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Golbov

customer_reviews.title: Great Matching color GM Engine Paint
customer_reviews.text: Perfect paint for 79 corvette valve covers. Paint covered beautifully...
customer_reviews.author: Mark Takacs

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I used the product to paint my brake calipers, i figured it was a safe bet with the high heat resistance. End result was very nice and holds up great. Have had many people ask if they were done professionally. However, the nozzle is hard to work with. I would have preferred a normal nozzle. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Devon M

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had to custom make an engine-mounted bracket for my 1954 Hudson Hornet. I sprayed it with this paint and it looks like part of the engine.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Robert N. Goldberg

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results
customer_reviews.text: Awesome paint and looks great on my engine. AVOID the universal white paint from this company though. It’ll eat through this blue and the primer.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent in custom matched paint job on indirect halogen uplights, mounted on the bedroom wall. Spot on match to the Benjamin Moore paint chip.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Garbage product
customer_reviews.text: The can came un pressurized and i cant figure out how to get a return or refund. I spent 10 dollars for a useless can of paint that has no pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Hello, Goes on rather thin so use caution. ...
customer_reviews.text: Hello, Goes on rather thin so use caution. Several light coats will provide a high gloss surface; let the paint flash at least 10 minutes between coats... Thank you, Joe
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Kieliszek

customer_reviews.title: Color As Pictured
customer_reviews.text: Good beige, tan color. Heat resistance is a plus. Follow instructions and take your time. I applied 4 coats within 24 hours. No runs in the paint.
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: always does a great job and will last
customer_reviews.text: Been using Plastikote paint for a long number of years; I really depend on it; always does a great job and will last.
customer_reviews.author: lee childers

customer_reviews.title: Great for Onan restoral
customer_reviews.text: After looking around locally and online, I found this color and quality of engine enamel to work great for the final paint job on an old Onan generator I was restoring. Plenty of paint in a can to cover large areas, sprays nicely and has held up well even in higher heat areas of the engine. Will be using this product on several other projects as well.
customer_reviews.author: CRn5oe

customer_reviews.title: Great paint.. Twice as much $$$
customer_reviews.text: Love the paint. Works extremely well in our application. Sprayer nozzle evenly distributes paint. Can't understand why price doubled from Aug 2017 to September 2017
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I added this on top of my Hemi orange just ...
customer_reviews.text: I added this on top of my Hemi orange just for a little extra protection, although it wasn't necessary since the orange was very glossy.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Frilling

customer_reviews.title: worth it
customer_reviews.text: used it on Toro lawn mower to make it look better.
customer_reviews.author: Runner_Chris

customer_reviews.title: I like the design of the spray nozzle setup and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I like the design of the spray nozzle setup and the color is what I wanted for my 81 K10 engine
customer_reviews.author: GG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to do touch up on my Dillon Reloading press. It matched perfectly. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Misenheimer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product fast shipping. Get the best bang for your buck. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Oleksandr

customer_reviews.title: which made me happy after using the engine primer which didn't
customer_reviews.text: This Chrysler orange covered very well, which made me happy after using the engine primer which didn't.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Frilling

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible! First off
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible! First off, paint barely squirts from can. And, the color was supposed to be "aluminum". Color was actually a very bright fake chrome color. Worthless. Threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole B.

customer_reviews.title: Almost like there where not enough solids in it
customer_reviews.text: This primer did not cover very well. Almost like there where not enough solids in it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Frilling

customer_reviews.title: Mopar match
customer_reviews.text: Perfect color match for my '70 Mopar 440 engine block.
customer_reviews.author: Victor M.

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality paint. My engine looks great. The mechanism is comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Macho Man

customer_reviews.title: Heat, maybe, but not flames
customer_reviews.text: It maybe can be used for heat, but when some flames came in contact with the paint, it just evaporated off.
customer_reviews.author: mystic

customer_reviews.title: Can not believe this product is still available.
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled to find this product as it was for a 1972 Pontiac. I actually used it to touch up the paint on my metal kitchen chairs and it is the most beautiful metallic blue, just like when I originally painted them. Price was reasonable and shipping was fairly quick.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Steinau

customer_reviews.title: inferior quality
customer_reviews.text: Paint clogs nozzle in short or long term use, regardless of temperature. Paint doesn't always mix properly, which leads to improper spray pattern and won't let paint cure properly. Nozzle leaks leaving paint all over your hands. All directions and conditions followed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pifer

customer_reviews.title: What can I say,  Its Ford Blue engine paint.
customer_reviews.text: I used on a 2x6 that clamps onto my hand loading bench. Only problem was we had a light rain a couple of hours after painting outside. Thought I would need to redo, but I moved board inside and carefully dried it off with a soft towel and a heat gun. Turned out great. How it works for engine parts, I have no idea, but it did a great job on my 2x6 board.
customer_reviews.author: Homer

customer_reviews.title: I was really satisfied with the finish of the product
customer_reviews.text: I was really satisfied with the finish of the product. I have yet tested it in high temperatures. I think it'll hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smooth flowing, easy to use and the color is perfect
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a silver that would be perfect for my engine and this is it. It's not a glossy silver when dried but it's what I was looking for .
customer_reviews.author: robert kemmler sr.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good product, best coverage and color on the market.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H.

customer_reviews.title: Plasti-Kote 225 Alpine Green Engine Enamel, 12 oz.
customer_reviews.text: Plasti-Kote 225 Alpine Green Engine Enamel, 12 oz. Amazing durability as a engine paint, it has a great smooth even look and an award winning shine. The newly designed can will hopefully eliminate the clogging of the nozzle that the old standard design had. The clogging nozzle was the only problem I had last time I purchased this product, because I used the paint in several small jobs over time If your going to use the whole can at one time this will not be an issue.Shake the can often or you will end up with a half full can of paint with no propellent.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Demco

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I used it for restoring an old Sears gas lantern. the color is a good match. It sprays good and looks great. I had no problems with using this paint.
customer_reviews.author: William F Scott

customer_reviews.title: I like this brand
customer_reviews.text: Been hearing a lot about plastkote lately and i see why.. the make great paint! Will purchase the brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Melo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: prime my engine like 3 times it cover really well
customer_reviews.author: charles

customer_reviews.title: I think they sacrificed a good spray pattern in return for a 'locking' can that ...
customer_reviews.text: Paint is okay and the PlastiKote brand is generally okay, in this instance the color does not match the cap and the nozzle on this particular version of can is way too broad. I think they sacrificed a good spray pattern in return for a 'locking' can that is hard to spray in the store.
customer_reviews.author: myatuck

customer_reviews.title: paint
customer_reviews.text: very good product!!! no problems with the paint and the can sprayed good with no runs in the paint thank you!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Kestler

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Covers much better than other "Mopar" paints and has a high gloss! Very nice paint.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Wise

customer_reviews.title: Color
customer_reviews.text: I was actually looking for a Detroit motor green. I was told that it was Alpine Green but this is too light and bright!
customer_reviews.author: kelby nance

customer_reviews.title: Bad can waste of money, time and work.
customer_reviews.text: Maybe a bad can, but the only way the paint fully sprayed properly was upside down. Which isn't proper at all. Coat sucked also. Very disappointed in this purchase. Total waste of money and added a lot of work for me with re-sanding and prepping.
customer_reviews.author: AMAZADDICT

customer_reviews.title: Plasti-Kote 206 Ford Red Engine Ename
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because it was the same color as my engine compartment and used it to paint my motor. It looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Abel Silva Jr

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product. It sticks well, dries fast, and looks outstanding. I've used it to paint my motor, my dash front and a few other little things. I would recommend this color and brand to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan J Crim

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Was too dark (a little too brown), I went with Dupli-Color
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Mueller

customer_reviews.title: average
customer_reviews.text: This paint is not as bad as the flat black and the universal black for some reason. That being said it is just average paint.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pifer

customer_reviews.title: good paint
customer_reviews.text: is the best paint for old engines, I been using this product for years and is hard to find at the storesm
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: unsatisfactory results
customer_reviews.text: The flat black paint is nearly impossible to work with. The paint clogs the nozzle in short or long term use, regardless of temperature. The paint doesn't always mix properly, which leads to improper spray pattern and won't let paint cure properly. The nozzle also leaks causing paint to run down your hand. All directions and conditions were followed.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Pifer

customer_reviews.title: Very good Product
customer_reviews.text: Very good coverage and paints flows well. I purchase this brand again
customer_reviews.author: ronald.gardner

customer_reviews.title: Not good at all.
customer_reviews.text: Despite shaking can for twenty plus minutes it continued to come out like rubberized undercoating. A complete waste... Why does Amazon require even one star for something that DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NOT for GM engines!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for the light blue or pontiac blue that was being used in GM cars, this is NOT the color for you. This is almost exactly FORD BLUE. I spent a weekend cleaning 30 years of oil and grease off my engine only to start painting and realize this is the wrong color. Go to Oreilly's and buy this part number instead: SP122
customer_reviews.author: Flash

customer_reviews.title: Expectation
customer_reviews.text: Yes it did meet my Expectation on the color. Very nice.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Harmon

product_meta.title: PlastiKote 230 Flat Black Engine Enamel, 12 oz.
product_meta.description: Color:Flat BlackPlasti-Kote's Engine Enamel dries to an extremely rugged, high heat resistant finish, making it the restorers' choice for over 75 years. Repeated exposure to engine heat up to 500°F will fuse engine enamel to the surface to increase bonding strength. Easy to use, this enamel is fully resistant to oil and gasoline, and will not weaken, crack, lift or peel, with exact color matches to original engine manufacturer standards. This is the answer for engine restorations and similar applications where a tough, high heat finish is required.
feature_bullets: The answer for engine restorations and similar applications where a tough, high heat finish is required
Repeated exposure to engine heat (up to 500°F) will fuse engine enamel to the surface to increase bonding strength
Fully resistant to oil and gasoline, and will not weaken, crack, lift or peel
Color choices are exact matches to original engine manufacturer standards
Easy to use, dries to an extremely rugged, high heat resistant finish
New look, same great product inside

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars168 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
